metadata.title: CVE-2016-8660 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The XFS subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.8.2 allows local users tocause a denial of service (fdatasync failure and system hang) by using thevfs syscall group in the trinity program, related to a "page lock order bugin the XFS seek hole/data implementation."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8660` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-27').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-27').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-01-27').
